title: Inheritance and Marriage
summary: Numbers 36 addresses a concern from the tribe of Manasseh about land inheritance. To preserve tribal boundaries, the daughters of Zelophehad are instructed to marry within their tribe so their land stays within their family.

faq.question: Why were the daughters of Zelophehad mentioned again?
faq.answer: To address how their inheritance would stay within their tribe through marriage.

faq.question: What principle does this teach?
faq.answer: That God values both justice and order, ensuring fairness while maintaining tribal unity.
